title: Ticket #3559: FD leak in ft-gahp
description:
It appears ft-gahp leaks FD descriptors via anonymous pipes: 

condor_ft 15622 sfiligoi 4090r  FIFO      0,7          15799842 pipe
condor_ft 15622 sfiligoi 4091r  FIFO      0,7          15799844 pipe
condor_ft 15622 sfiligoi 4092r  FIFO      0,7          15799846 pipe

This caused the ft-gahp to run out of file descriptors. This causes ft-gahp to soft-fail - it appears to continue to run, but fail (maybe?) the transfers. 

03/28/13 15:20:31 [15622] got stdin: DOWNLOAD_SANDBOX 9268 cabinet-10-10-6.t2.ucsd.edu_9618_cabinet-10-10-6.t2.ucsd.edu#5165.0#1364479273 [\ Out\ =\ "_condor_stdout";\ TransferSocket\ =\ "<127.0.0.1:57043>";\ x509userproxy\ =\ "/home/gfactory/clientproxies/user_gfactory/glidein_v1_0/entry_Gordon2/x509_Gordon2@v1_0@GordonGF@fnalfesrv156.minus,v2.dot,main_0_959056.proxy";\ Cmd\ =\ "/home/gfactory/glideinsubmit/glidein_v1_0/glidein_startup.sh";\ TransferOutput\ =\ "";\ CurrentTime\ =\ time();\ In\ =\ "/dev/null";\ Err\ =\ "_condor_stderr";\ TransferKey\ =\ "160b#5154c22f2e0e08d45e2a1251";\ Iwd\ =\ "/home/gfactory/glideinsubmit/glidein_v1_0"\ ]
03/28/13 15:20:31 [15622] Create_Thread: pipe() failed with errno 24 (Too many open files)
03/28/13 15:20:31 [15622] BOSCO: Create_Thread FAILED!
03/28/13 15:20:31 [15622] put stdout: S
03/28/13 15:21:15 [15622] got stdin: RESULTS
03/28/13 15:21:15 [15622] put stdout: S 0

This is with the BOSCO release from 7.9.2.
remarks:
2013-Apr-01 12:23:47 by jfrey:
There are two bugs here. The file descriptor leak and the gahp not indicating an error when it can't perform commands once the fds run out.
